clinical_study.brief_title: Bismuth Quadruple Therapy With Cefuroxime for Helicobacter Pylori Eradication Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Randomized Controlled Study of Bismuth Quadruple Therapy With Cefuroxime as Rescue Therapy for Helicobacter Pylori Infection

brief_summary.textblock: To observe the efficacy of cefuroxime-containing bismuth quadruple regimen in the eradication treatment of Helicobacter pylori, and to evaluate whether it can be used as a remedial treatment for Helicobacter pylori after initial or repeated treatment failure.

detailed_description.textblock: Introducing cefuroxime into the remedy treatment of Helicobacter pylori, on the one hand, the investigators will observe whether cefuroxime can replace tetracycline like amoxicillin, on the other hand, the investigators will observe whether it can reduce the rate of adverse effects caused by tetracycline and avoid the allergy of penicillin. If the experiment is successful, it will provide an effective and safe second-line treatment for the majority of patients with failed treatment of Helicobacter pylori.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of success rates after 14 days of eradicate treatment with helicobacter pylori using a bismuth quadruple regimen containing cefuroxime and a classic bismuth quadruple regimen
primary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of treatment is 14 days. A C13 UBT will be performed 1 month after treatment.
primary_outcome.description: The comparison of eradication rate (0-100%), it is better to have a higher eradication rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Success rate of cefuroxime-containing bismuth quadruple regimen in the treatment of refractory Helicobacter pylori after 14 days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: A C13 UBT will be performed 1 month after treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: The eradication rate of new regimen in refractory Helicobacter pylori treatment (0-100%)

secondary_outcome.measure: In vitro culture and drug sensitivity test of Helicobacter pylori were conducted to observe the drug resistance rate of Helicobacter pylori to cefuroxime, tetracycline and metronidazole.
secondary_outcome.description: The drug resistance rate of Helicobacter pylori to cefuroxime, tetracycline and metronidazole（0-100%）

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse effect rate and safety of cefuroxime-containing bismuth quadruple regimen and classical bismuth quadruple regimen in patients with refractory Helicobacter pylori.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cefuroxime containing bismuth quadruple treatment group

intervention.description: Cefuroxime containing bismuth quadruple treatment: Rabeprazole 20mg bid po, Colloidal Bismuth Pectin 200mg bid po, Cefuroxime 500mg bid po, Metronidazole 400mg tid po Treatment duration is 14 days.
intervention.arm_group_label: Cefuroxime containing bismuth quadruple treatment group

intervention.description: Classic bismuth quadruple treatment: Rabeprazole 20mg bid po, Colloidal Bismuth Pectin 200mg bid po, Tetracycline 500mg qid po, Metronidazole 400mg tid po Treatment duration is 14 days.
